claim: Vaccination with a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine may induce a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines.
explanation: Flowchart showing whether a child who received ≥2 doses of trivalent or quadrivalent influenza vaccine before July 1, 2022 should receive 1 dose or 2 doses (≥4 weeks apart) of the 2022–23 influenza vaccine. The figure is an algorithm for pediatric influenza vaccine dosing based on prior vaccination history and does not support the claim about higher-dose recombinant vaccines inducing a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines.
